line: Receiver Connecting Wire: The SXX-SS V2 is equipped with
label: paragraph

line: an LRP Multicon receiver wire. As supplied, it will easily fit in
label: paragraph

line: all ordinary receivers. Make sure you connect it to receiver
label: paragraph

line: with correct polarity and use channel 2.
label: paragraph

line: Sensor Connector: The bi-directional multipole sensor wire
label: paragraph

line: connects the speed-control and the motor. Always use the
label: paragraph

line: sensor wire and do not alter or modify this cable! There are
label: paragraph

line: replaceable/optional hall sensor wires available.
label: paragraph

line: Through this sensor connector, the SXX-SS V2 can also be
label: paragraph

line: updated with the latest software updates using the optional
label: paragraph

line: „USB Bridge #81800“. Please refer to chapter „USB Soft-
label: paragraph

line: ware Updateability“ for details
label: paragraph

line: Power Wires: For maximum performance, flexible silicone
label: paragraph

line: power wires without any connectors are used. The unique
label: paragraph

line: splitted solder-tabs allow easy and convenient replacement
label: paragraph

line: of the power wires. Nevertheless some soldering skills are
label: paragraph

line: required. Avoid soldering longer then 5sec per joint to avo-
label: paragraph

line: id possible damage due to overheating of the components!
label: paragraph

line: There are replacement power wires available, please refer to
label: paragraph

line: complete line-up at www.LRP.cc.
label: paragraph

line: Heatsink: To achieve best perfomance even under extreme
label: paragraph

line: conditions, the heatsink has been directly mounted to the
label: paragraph

line: speed-control. This ensures the best possible heat transfer
label: paragraph

line: away from the speed-control.
label: paragraph

line: Caution: Never attempt to remove the heatsink or your SXX-
label: paragraph

line: SS V2 may get damaged! The heatsink is an integral part,
label: paragraph

line: glued to the fet‘s and therefore cannot be removed.
label: paragraph

line: Optional plugged fan: for stock racing a fan is not required as the speed-control doesn‘t become very warm, but
label: paragraph

line: if you wish to add the optional fan (#82512) it can be mounted on top of the heatsink and then it get‘s plugged into
label: paragraph

line: the 3-pin connector on the front.
label: paragraph

line: Installation Guide
label: heading

line: Position the speed-control and capacitor where they are protected in the event of a crash and gives you easy
label: paragraph

line: access to the connectors and buttons.
label: paragraph

line: Mount the speedo and capacitor using the supplied thick/black doubled-sided tape
label: paragraph

line: Make sure there is enough clearance between the speed-control, power-wires, antenna and receiver. Avoid
label: paragraph

line: any direct contact between power components, the receiver or the antenna as this can cause interference. If
label: paragraph

line: interference occurs, position the components at a different place in the model.
label: paragraph

line: The aerial should be run vertically up and away from the receiver. Avoid contact with any parts made of carbon
label: paragraph

line: fibre or metal. If the aerial is too long, don’t coil up the excess length. See also the instructions supplied with
label: paragraph

line: your radio control system.
label: paragraph

line: The SXX-SS V2 comes supplied with flexible 3.3mm² silicone power-wires without connectors. Be very careful
label: paragraph

line: with the correct wire sequence/colors since an incorrect connection may damage the speed-control! Avoid crea-
label: paragraph

line: ting solder bridges on the solder-tabs and isolate all connections carefully.
label: paragraph

line: Connect the speed-control to the receiver (position: Channel 2
label: paragraph

line: Blue power-wire ? Speedo MOT.A to motor „A“
label: paragraph

line: Yellow power-wire ? Speedo MOT.B to motor „B“
label: paragraph

line: Orange power-wire ? Speedo MOT.C to motor „C“
label: paragraph

line: Connect the hall sensor cable to the speed-control (underneath the solder-tabs) and the motor.
label: paragraph

line: yellow orange Wire
label: paragraph

line: blue
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: Doublecheck all connections before connecting the speed-control to a battery.
label: paragraph

line: Caution: If battery is connected with reversed polarity it will destroy your speed-control!
label: paragraph

line: Red power-wire ? Speedo BAT+ to battery „Plus“
label: paragraph

line: Black power-wire ? Speedo BAT- to battery „Minus“
label: paragraph

line: The speed-control is now ready to be set-up.
label: paragraph

line: USB Software Updateability
label: heading

line: Through the sensor connector the SXX-SS V2 can be updated to the latest firmware available for download at
label: paragraph

line: www.LRP.cc.
label: paragraph

line: The optional „USB Bridge - Speedo Firmware Update + PC-Link“ (#81800) and a PC are required to do so, please
label: paragraph

line: refer to LRP website and the manual which comes with the interface for exact details how to do software updates
label: paragraph

line: to your speed-control.
label: paragraph

line: The same USB-Bridge can be used to update all the latest LRP speed-controls (80905, 80955, 80880, etc). Please
label: paragraph

line: check guide at ww.LRP.cc for further details.
label: paragraph

line: Please read the following instructions carefully before you start using your speed control. This user guide contains
label: paragraph

line: important notes for the safety, the use and the maintenance of this product. Thus protecting yourself and avoid damages
label: paragraph

line: of the product.
label: paragraph

line: Proceed according to the user guide in order to understand your speed control better. Please take your time as you will
label: paragraph

line: have much more joy with your product if you know it exactly.
label: paragraph

line: This user manual shall be kept in a safe place. If another customer is using this product, this manual has to be handed
label: paragraph

line: out together with it.
label: paragraph

line: Calibrate Speed-Control to Radio
label: heading

line: In setup mode the speed-control stores every step (e.g. learning your radios neutral and endpoints) by pressing the
label: paragraph

line: SET button. All the settings will be stored in the memory even if it will be disconnected from the battery.
label: paragraph

line: TRANSMITTER SETTINGS: Setup the following basic functions on your transmitter (if available):
label: paragraph

line: Throttle Travel High ATV, EPA 100%
label: paragraph

line: Brake Travel Low ATV, EPA, ATL 100%
label: paragraph

line: Throttle Exponential EXP, EXPO start with 0
label: paragraph

line: Neutral Trim SUB Trim centre
label: paragraph

line: Servo Reverse Throttle Reverse any setting, don‘t change after set-up procedure!
label: paragraph

line: If your transmitter doesn‘t offer any of above functions, it‘s already in „basic setup“ mode.
label: paragraph

line: Ensure that the speed-control is not connected to the drive battery and is switched off.
label: paragraph

line: Remove motor pinion or ensure that the wheels of the model are free to rotate.
label: paragraph

line: Switch the transmitter on and set the transmitter throttle stick to neutral.
label: paragraph

line: Connect the speed-control to the battery and switch the unit on.
label: paragraph

line: Hold the SET button pressed for at least 3sec.
label: paragraph

line: You entered setup mode and the SET LED flashes blue (it will flash until the setup is completed).
label: paragraph

line: Leave transmitter in neutral position and press the SET button once.
label: paragraph

line: Neutral setting is stored , MODE LED flashes yellow and the motor beeps.
label: paragraph

line: Hold full throttle on transmitter and press the SET button once.
label: paragraph

line: Full-throttle setting is stored, MODE LED flashes red.
label: paragraph

line: Hold full brake on transmitter and press the SET button once.
label: paragraph

line: Brake setting is stored, LED‘s glow red (MODE) and blue (SET).
label: paragraph

line: This completes the setup procedure and your SXX-SS V2 is ready to use.
label: paragraph

line: If you make a mistake during the setup procedure, don‘t worry: Disconnect the battery for about 10sec and start
label: paragraph

line: again from the first step.
label: paragraph

line: At the start of each run switch on the transmitter first, then switch on the car.
label: paragraph

line: At the end of each run switch of the car, and then switch off the transmitter.
label: paragraph

line: For storage of the car, disconnect the drive battery at any time!
label: paragraph

line: Check the LED‘s when moving the throttle on your radio to doublecheck everything is setup correctly.
label: paragraph

line: Multi Protection System 3
label: heading

line: New and improved protection system „MPS3“ which also informs you the cause of the shutdown with a special
label: paragraph

line: LED flashing sequence. You can indicate that a shutdown occured when blue SET LED flashes very fast and the
label: paragraph

line: „error code“ (= cause for shutdown) is indicated by the MODE LED‘s as explained in table below.
label: paragraph

line: Error Code LED flashing sequences:
label: paragraph

line: Error Mode Set
label: paragraph

line: Code LED‘s
label: paragraph

line: Reason Possible Cause
label: paragraph

line: Active power reduction at critical temperatures: The cut-off function for both motor- and speed-control
label: paragraph

line: temperature is now an active type, in case you‘re getting near critical temperatures the speed-control will auto-
label: paragraph

line: matically switch to „Boost0“ mode during operation. A critical temperature is considered as equal to 9 flashes!
label: paragraph

line: This function allows you to finish your run or at least reach the pitlane during running, at reduced speed, as other-
label: paragraph

line: weise you would not finish your run!
label: paragraph

line: The blue LED will flash, in case the 9 flashes where reached during the run (to indicate it switched to „Boost0
label: paragraph

line: mode“), but this mode will of course not be stored in the memory but your choosen profiles will be active for next
label: paragraph

line: run (after switching off/on) again.
label: paragraph

line: You should not exceed 8 flashes during normal use for both motor- and speed-control temperature, please adjust
label: paragraph

line: your ADPCmax.2 profiles and motor accordingly, so you stay within these safe limits. The final thermal cut-off will
label: paragraph

line: occur at 10 flashes, as explained further down.
label: paragraph

line: At your own risk: if you wish to disable motor temperature cut-off completely you can do so by using value 0
label: paragraph

line: in Mode.1. We call this function „Hardcore Racing Mode“. as it also disables the cell-voltage cut-off completely.
label: paragraph

line: Important: The speed-controls thermal cut-off can not be disabled!
label: paragraph

line: Internal-Temp-Check System 3: allows you to read-out the maximum internal temperature that the speedo
label: paragraph

line: and motor have reached during the run. You can convienently read-out the temperature back in the pits since it
label: paragraph

line: remains stored until you turn it on the next time regularly (which will reset the memory). This feature allows you to
label: paragraph

line: accurately check if all is running well or if you‘re close to shutdown already.
label: paragraph

line: How to read-out the temperature:
label: paragraph

line: switch at „OFF“ position.
label: paragraph

line: keep MODE button pressed while you turn switch to „ON“ (then release button).
label: paragraph

line: at first speed-control temperature will be indicated.
label: paragraph

line: SET LED will start to flash blue (MODE LED‘s are off) ....
label: paragraph

line: count the number of flashes.The higher the number, the hotter the speedo ran (shutdown occurs at 10 flashes).
label: paragraph

line: to change to motor temperature read-out, press MODE button one more time.
label: paragraph

line: SET LED will start to flash blue (MODE LED‘s are off) again, for motor the LED‘s on time will be shorter.
label: paragraph

line: count the number of flashes.The higher the number, the hotter the motor ran (shutdown occurs at 10 flashes).
label: paragraph

line: every flash below 10 equals to 5°C temperature decrease.
label: paragraph

line: Temperature chart (speed-control and motor temperature):
label: paragraph

line: Caution: motor temperature read-out only works if motor has a built-in NTC temperature sensor!
label: paragraph
